title: About mod
line1: What is Sophisticated Wolves? It's a mod that aims to improve wolves in the games through a series of gameplay tweaks, AI improvements, and added features. The focus is not to have overpowered items or crazy abilities, but rather balanced additions that make sense in the world of MC. Essentially, wolves should be able to better respond to your actions and take care of themselves, so you don't have to consider them a liability when mining, exploring or fighting.
line2: This is an updated and reworked version of metroidfood's "Sophisticated Wolves" mod. Mostly it is the same as metroidfood's version except some new features and improvements.
line3: In this version "Sophisticated wolves" are an own type of wolves, which spawned separately from "vanilla" wolves. You can find them in the world or make your tamed "vanilla" wolves sophisticated. Your tamed "vanilla" wolves will become sophisticated if you give them a "dog treat".

zoologist.title: Zoologist
zoologist.line1: Zoologist is a new villager who sells name tags, dog treats, and pet carriers with various pets: chickens, rabbits, parrots, cats and dogs, as well as exotic ocelots and foxes.
zoologist.line2: A zoologist can be found in some villages, not far from a kennels - a small structure consisting of several dog houses with bowls and wild dogs.
zoologist.line3: In order to make an unemployed villager to become a zoologist, just place a dog house and a bowl.

commands.title: Commands
commands.line1: By using a regular bone on a tamed wolf, you can teach it new tricks and adjust its behavior. The list of these options is small and divided into 3 groups:
commands.line2: Types of food that wolves will seek out and consume on their own.
commands.line3: Attack targets – allows you to specify which monsters the wolf should attack and which it should ignore.
commands.line4: Behavior – either following the owner or guarding a territory.

nametags.title: Name tags
nametags.line1: One of the most oft-requested features, names to differentiate between your pets. Craft a leather Dog Tag and you'll be able to give your pet a proper name(it can be applied to any tameable pet). They behave like normal player name tags when standing but are not visible through walls when sitting.
nametags.line2: Nameplates will also change color according to the health of your wolf. White = full health, and it gets progressively more red as a wolf's health goes down.

breeding.title: Breeding
breeding.line1: No more accidental breeding, wolves now have a new item to get them in the mood. Feed two tamed wolves a Dog Treat made out of two wheat and a porkchop (raw or cooked) and they'll produce a puppy. Puppies are automatically tamed and will inherit a parent's breed.

biomeWolves.title: Biome-Specific Wolves
biomeWolves.line1: Wolves' appearance will vary depending on the biome they spawn in. Snowy biomes wolves are the classic gray, Taiga wolves are black, Dark Forest wolves are brown. All other wolves are light brown.

creeper.title: Creeper Avoidance
creeper.line1: Wolves are loyal, not stupid. If they see a Creeper about to explode they'll scatter regardless of what you're doing.
creeper.line2: Furthermore wolves will try to hold distance of 3 blocks from creepers(in any state).

evil.title: Evil Detecting Dogs
evil.line1: Though they won't attack Creepers, wolves will growl to alert you if one is nearby.

extinguishing.title: Fire and poison protection
extinguishing.line1: Tired of your wolves burning to death? So are they. If they happen to catch on fire, they'll stop and shake to put themselves out.
extinguishing.line2: Similar behavior can be observed at poisoning and withering. When wolf ate something dangerous, or become poisoned in any other way, it 'll try to puke it out, thereby removing the negative effect.

waterproof.title: Waterproof Wolves
waterproof.line1: No more death of water! Drowning wolves will be teleported to its owner.

cacti.title: Cactiproof Wolves
cacti.line1: Cacti can't hurt wolves anymore(can be disabled)

collision.title: Better collision
collision.line1: Wolves can't collide with each other so they will not be doomed to fall (in a lava or from a cliff) by each other anymore.

friendlyFire.title: Friendly fire
friendlyFire.line1: Wolves can be hit by its owner only when owner is sneaking.(It should protect wolves from accidental hit)

respawn.title: Respawning Wolves
respawn.line0: This feature was removed since 4.0.0 update
respawn.line1: Like ocelots, wolves will spawn sporadically in Taiga and Forest biomes and only become persistent when tamed. This also means they won't stick around if you wander off so be sure to bring bones with you if you're looking for wolves!
respawn.line2: But you can change it configuration file - set "RespawningWolves" to "false". It will prevent untamed wolves despawn, but, at the same time new "wild" sophisticated wolves will not spawn again.

feeding.title: Feeding
feeding.line1: Wolves will now also gobble down fish. In addition, they will no longer wander around while begging, so you don't have to chase them down trying to feed them.
feeding.line2: Furthermore wolves become more self-sustained - they will search all around for any acceptable food and eat it from the ground to heal itself. But previously you should train them with bone.
feeding.line3: Another improvement in dogs feeding is - Dog Bowls. Instead of giving wolves food from hands all the time they were damaged - just craft Dog Bowl, place it somewhere in the house and fill it with food, so wolves can feeds itself when it needed.

transporting.title: Pet Carriers
transporting.line1: This small but incredibly handy item can be used to transporting your dogs and even some another small pets and animals(chickens, rabbits, parrots, ocelots and foxes) in your inventory. Furthermore it can be used to change owner of the pet.

canceling.title: Attack Pausing/Canceling
canceling.line1: Crouching with Shift will make any wolves currently attacking a creature stand still and stop attacking. Holding down Shift for around 5 seconds will cancel their attack entirely, so they don't slaughter your flock of sheep because you accidentally punched them. Wolves will also lose interest in a target if you're far enough away from it when they teleport to you.
canceling.line2: To make wolves more controllable you can craft Dog Whistle. It summons all walking wolves in range of 35 blocks to its owner and discard all their tasks at usage. If you'll sneaking at its usage it summons sitting dogs too.

sheep.title: Sheep farm protection
sheep.line0: This feature was removed since 4.0.0 update
sheep.line1: As far as sophisticated wolves can be respawned in the world you may need a way to protect your sheep farms from wild wolves. Just light your farm - wolves can't be spawned in lighted places(light level should be higher than 5).

mining.title: Peace of Mining
mining.line1: Wolves will no longer wander around and bump into you when you're mining or on a ladder, instead they'll wait patiently for you to finish (unless you're being attacked by monsters of course).

tweak.title: Tweakable
tweak.line1: Want to use a texture pack instead of biome-specific wolves? Don't like wild wolves despawning? Want to set breeding back to default? Change it in the config file, located in your .minecraft/config folder.

miscellaneous.title: Miscellaneous Improvements
miscellaneous.line1: Smarter teleportation, fire avoidance, more responsive interactions, and many other various bug fixes and tweaks have been made to improve your experience with wolves. Check out the changelog for more detailed notes.
